instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no orange light
threads.message: Hello, I have a 3435 with no orange light. Corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C7098</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7095</RESISTOR>. After replacement still a short to ground, removed <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> and on pin 6 I get 0.329v and on 1/2/4 0.022v so there is some short on the outside. Voltage I get on pin 6 = 15.06v is that correct? How should i go about, but power on the line see where it gets hot?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no orange light
threads.message: Inject 3V on pin 2 of L7095 and see if anything heats up. SMC is a good suspect. I assume the 0.022v is a diode mode measurement?
